results.title: Jane Fonda
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Michael Barnes
results.brief_description: A documentary about Jane Fonda, her family, social and political activities and her own account of how she came to break with her Hollywood background. Focuses on the contradictions and controversies which she has had to resolve in her private life and in her career as an actress.

results.title: Jane Eyre. Part 2
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Barry Letts and Julian Amyes
results.brief_description: Having fled Thornfield and Rochester, Jane is taken in and cared for by the handsome young clergyman St John Rivers and his sisters, Diana and Mary. Finally Jane is confronted with her most testing challenge - to accept St John Rivers’ offer to join him as his wife and fellow missionary or to return to Thornfield Hall and seek future happiness with Mr Rochester.

results.title: Jane Eyre. Part 1
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Barry Letts and Julian Amyes
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Charlotte Bronte’s novel stars Timothy Dalton as the brusque Mr. Rochester and Zelah Clarke as the small but ‘independently spirited’ Jane. Jane leaves Lowood school, a charitable institute where she has spent the last eight years of her life, and secures a position at Thornfield Hall as a governess - in the employ of the mysterious Mr. Rochester.

results.title: Jane Eyre by Charlotte Bronte
results.creator_credit: LWT, Greg Brenman and Robert Young
results.brief_description: Samantha Morton stars as Charlotte Bronte’s young orphaned girl, Jane Eyre, who takes the position of governess to the daughter of the mysterious Edward Rochester (Ciaran Hinds), master of a large and eerie house on the Yorkshire Moors - Thornfield Hall. Will she receive the same harsh treatment she has always known as a child - or will she find the love she has always longed for? And what dark secret lies hidden at the top of the house? Cast also includes Gemma Jones, Timia Berthome and Blanche Ingramas. This made for television feature is the tenth screen adaptation of the famous novel.

results.title: Jane Eyre
results.creator_credit: Rochester Films, Cineritmo, Flach Film, Dyson Lovell and Franco Zeffirelli
results.brief_description: Jane Eyre has lived a sad life since she was orphaned as a child. Shuffled between relatives and boarding school, she has never really known love. However, when she takes the job of governess to the illegitimate ward of nobleman, Edward Rochester, she experiences warmth and security for the very first time. When she and Rochester fall in love and he proposes marriage, it seems that finally, she will know happiness - until a devastating secret threatens to destroy the one thing she so desperately desires. Cast includes William Hurt, Charlotte Gainsbourg, Joan Plowright, Anna Paquin and Elle MacPherson. This is an enthralling love story based on the classic novel by Charlotte Bronte.

results.title: Jane Eyre
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Barry Letts and Julian Amyes
results.brief_description: Featuring Timothy Dalton and Zelah Clarke, Jane Eyre leaves a charitable institution to work for the mysterious Mr. Rochester. Thornfield is a house of many secrets and Jane embark’s on a journey of self discovery, where not only her values, but her chances of finding love and happiness, are threatened. Based on the novel by Charlotte Bronte.

results.title: Jane Eyre
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, William Goetz and Robert Stevenson
results.brief_description: A young orphaned girl, Jane Eyre (Joan Fontaine) takes the position of governess to the daughter of the mysterious Edward Rochester (Orson Welles), master of a large and eerie house on the Yorkshire Moors. Will she receive the same harsh treatment she has always known as a child - or will she find the love she has always longed for? And what dark secret lies hidden at the top of the house? Based on the novel by Charlotte Bronte the script- writers include Aldous Huxley. Features Margaret O’Brien as the young Jane and Elizabeth Taylor as her orphan friend.

results.title: Jane Edmanson's guide to houseplants
results.creator_credit: Ernest Heffelmyer, Gardening Australia Magazine and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Jane Edmandson hosts this “Gardening Australia” special on houseplants which covers plant selection, containers and accessories, maintenance, repotting, dealing effectively with pests and diseases, over and underwatering, propagation by cuttings and division, popular flowering and foliage plants, unusual plants such as cacti, orchids and Bonsai, terrariums, holiday care and plant scaping.

results.title: Jane Campion filmmaker
results.creator_credit: AFTRS and Television and Radio School
results.brief_description: Director Jane Campion tells Peter Thompson of her beginnings as a filmmaker, and her relationship with the film school. This program includes excerpts from Jane’s films “Girls own story” and “Sweetie”.

results.title: Jane Austen in Manhattan
results.creator_credit: Merchant Ivory Productions, Polytel Films, Ismail Merchant and James Ivory
results.brief_description: Anne Baxter, in one of her greatest performances, plays the elegant Lilianna, an actress and drama coach, struggling to produce a newly discovered Jane Austen play. However, the manuscript is in the hands of Pierre (Robert Powell), an ex-student of Lilianna’s, who has broken away from traditional theatre values into bizzare experimental techniques and a raging tug-of-war ensues between the traditional and experimental. Co-starring Michael Wager, Tim Choate, Sean Young, John Guerrasio, Katrina Hodiak, Kurt Johnson, Philip Lenkowsky, Nancy New and Charles McCaughan. Written by Ruth Prawer Jhabvala and based upon Sir Charles Grandison or “The Happy Man”.
